title: Net charge on inner surface of conducting shell

content.question: A spherical conducting shell has a net charge of <math alttext="positive 5 Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. At the center of the shell, there is a point charge of <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>+Q</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. Which of the following gives the charge on the inner surface of the shell and provides evidence to support this claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the electric field inside the conducting shell is zero.
